title: From spying on wife to fishing for company intel, Sebi battles bizarre RTI requests
content: The Right to Information route, or RTIs - meant to be a tool for transparency – has attracted strange, personal, and downright bizarre queries, as has been evident in some of the recent filings with the market regulator Securities and Exchange Board of India (Sebi). Sampling the queries revealed one curious case where a husband used the RTI route to seek details of his wife's financial portfolio, while another RTI asked for guidance on lodging a corruption case against a certain Sebi official. There are also regular queries from those whom Sebi calls ‘habitual RTI filers’. Moneycontrol managed to look inside the world of weird RTIs landing at Sebi’s doorstep, including this one application received by Sebi on April 26, 2025 where the applicant sought the following details:“A. Is my wife XXXXXXXXXX holding a DEMAT Account? B. If so, how many DEMAT accounts and their details? C. Is my wife XXXXXXXXXX holding a trading account? D. If so, how many trading accounts and their details? E. Has my wife XXXXXXXXXX invested in any mutual funds? F. If so, could you furnish the details of the mutual funds? G. I request to share other information of my wife, XXXXXXXXXX, that pertains to shares, dividends, capital gains, FDRs, mutual funds, stocks, debentures, etc.” Sebi's CPIO informed that the information sought is not maintained by Sebi in the normal course, and hence, is not available with the regulator. Subsequently, the applicant went into appeal, but was later rejected. Another case of an RTI filed with Sebi on May 26, 2025 revealed a query seeking information about where to file a complaint against a Sebi official. “Ms. XXXXXXXXX has been caught red-handed defending (proof attached) the Depository Participant—Bank of Maharashtra—and protecting them from disciplinary actions arising out of multiple regulatory violations spread over a period of one year. Should a misconduct complaint be filed against Ms. XXXX directly with the SEBI Chief, or the CVO, or the Anti-Corruption Bureau, or the Ministry of Finance?” Another application was filed by the same person on how to file a case against a Sebi official, asking, “How to file a formal corruption case against Ms. XXXXX XXXX, who is a XXX in SEBI?” In this case, the CPIO conveyed that the information for lodging complaints against employees of Sebi is available on the watchdog’s website. Yet, an appeal was filed on the ground that access to the information requested was refused, which was rejected on the grounds that the information sought is available in public domain. One RTI applicant - a frequent filer –constantly seeks details of NOCs issued by Sebi to multiple companies for IPOs such as Belrise Industries, Ather Energy, TCNS Clothing, HDFC AMC, RNEL, Tech Mahindra etc. Sebi’s CPIO has consistently replied that such information is not available with the regulator, yet the RTI filings have continued. Sebi noted that not only for the companies mentioned, but the applicant also sought ‘copies of Sebi’s permission or NOC’ for various other listed companies too, through numerous RTI applications. The appellate authority under RTI at Sebi observed that “such repetitive filing of RTI applications amounts to misuse/abuse of the RTI Act”. In the past, there have been instances where one complainant had filed as many as 578 RTIs. As per Sebi’s annual report, in the last two years, 150-300 RTIs were received every month, raising around 6,500-17,000 queries. Similarly, 300-800 appeals too were received. On many occasions, people send complaints as RTIs, for which Sebi has a dedicated SCORES portal. Shailesh Gandhi, Former Chief Information Commissioner told Moneycontrol that public authorities should freely share information as per the mandate of the RTI Act. “Citizens are the owners of the assets of the country, and owners should not be denied information about their assets”, Gandhi added. On concerns of misuse, he said, “There are clear-cut carve-outs like intellectual property, privacy, etc.” Many times, RTIs are more about giving information than seeking information, and hence they get rejected. That’s not all, sometimes the reason for rejection could be the framing of queries, as many people pose them in an interrogatory manner instead of seeking information, people familiar with the issue told Moneycontrol. Also Read: Merchant bankers are gearing up for a ‘beauty parade’ in anticipation of NSE’s IPO RTI experts suggest for a better strike rate in getting information, it is important to know which public authority may have the information. Also, asking for personal information will not get results. The application should be in the tone of seeking information and not informing or raising a question. Information already available in public domain asked under RTI is unlikely to get any response. For better and quicker response online RTI mode through https://rtionline.gov.in is advised.
summary_lexrank: Moneycontrol managed to look inside the world of weird RTIs landing at Sebi’s doorstep, including this one application received by Sebi on April 26, 2025 where the applicant sought the following details:“A.
summary_luhn: Should a misconduct complaint be filed against Ms. XXXX directly with the SEBI Chief, or the CVO, or the Anti-Corruption Bureau, or the Ministry of Finance?” Another application was filed by the same person on how to file a case against a Sebi official, asking, “How to file a formal corruption case against Ms. XXXXX XXXX, who is a XXX in SEBI?” In this case, the CPIO conveyed that the information for lodging complaints against employees of Sebi is available on the watchdog’s website.

title: Hindustan Unilever shares surge nearly 5% in today's session
content: Shares of Hindustan Unilever were trading with a gain of 4.87% at Rs 2,525.60 in Friday's session. The stock is showing bullish momentum in today's session. The stock touched a day's high of Rs 2,530.00 and a low of Rs 2,461.00.Financial PerformanceThe following table presents the consolidated quarterly financial performance of Hindustan Unilever:HeadingMar 2025Dec 2024Sep 2024Jun 2024Mar 2024SalesRs 15,670 CroreRs 15,818 CroreRs 15,926 CroreRs 15,707 CroreRs 15,210 CroreOther IncomeRs 309 CroreRs 232 CroreRs 219 CroreRs 257 CroreRs 231 CroreTotal IncomeRs 15,979 CroreRs 16,050 CroreRs 16,145 CroreRs 15,964 CroreRs 15,441 CroreTotal ExpenditureRs 12,536 CroreRs 11,957 CroreRs 12,487 CroreRs 12,340 CroreRs 11,917 CroreEBITRs 3,443 CroreRs 4,093 CroreRs 3,658 CroreRs 3,624 CroreRs 3,524 CroreInterestRs 80 CroreRs 112 CroreRs 110 CroreRs 93 CroreRs 105 CroreTaxRs 887 CroreRs 993 CroreRs 947 CroreRs 917 CroreRs 858 CroreNet ProfitRs 2,476 CroreRs 2,988 CroreRs 2,601 CroreRs 2,614 CroreRs 2,561 CroreThe revenue for the quarter-ending March 2025 was Rs 15,670 Crore, slightly lower compared to the Rs 15,818 Crore in the quarter-ending December 2024. The net profit for the quarter-ending March 2025 stood at Rs 2,476 Crore, a decrease from Rs 2,988 Crore in the quarter-ending December 2024. The following table presents the consolidated yearly financial performance:HeadingMar 2025Mar 2024Mar 2023Mar 2022Mar 2021SalesRs 63,121 CroreRs 61,896 CroreRs 60,580 CroreRs 52,446 CroreRs 47,028 CroreOther IncomeRs 1,017 CroreRs 811 CroreRs 512 CroreRs 258 CroreRs 410 CroreTotal IncomeRs 64,138 CroreRs 62,707 CroreRs 61,092 CroreRs 52,704 CroreRs 47,438 CroreTotal ExpenditureRs 49,320 CroreRs 48,443 CroreRs 47,632 CroreRs 40,724 CroreRs 36,715 CroreEBITRs 14,818 CroreRs 14,264 CroreRs 13,460 CroreRs 11,980 CroreRs 10,723 CroreInterestRs 395 CroreRs 334 CroreRs 114 CroreRs 106 CroreRs 117 CroreTaxRs 3,744 CroreRs 3,644 CroreRs 3,201 CroreRs 2,987 CroreRs 2,606 CroreNet ProfitRs 10,679 CroreRs 10,286 CroreRs 10,145 CroreRs 8,887 CroreRs 8,000 CroreThe annual revenue for March 2025 was Rs 63,121 Crore, an increase from Rs 61,896 Crore in March 2024. The net profit for the year ended March 2025 was Rs 10,679 Crore, up from Rs 10,286 Crore in the previous year. Key financial ratios for Hindustan Unilever show a P/E ratio of 49.84 and a P/B ratio of 10.75 as of March 2025. The company reported a debt-to-equity ratio of 0.00 as of the year-ending March 2025.Corporate ActionsHindustan Unilever announced the cessation of Mr. Rohit Jawa as MD & CEO effective close of business hours on July 31, 2025. Additionally, Ms. Priya Nair has been appointed as MD & CEO effective August 1, 2025. Hindustan Unilever announced a final dividend of Rs 24 per share on April 24, 2025, with an effective date of June 23, 2025. Prior dividends include an interim dividend of Rs 19 per share and a special dividend of Rs 10 per share, both announced on October 10 and 11, 2024, respectively, with an effective date of November 6, 2024. The company had also announced bonus issues in the past, including a bonus ratio of 1:2 with ex-bonus date as July 19, 1991. Hindustan Unilever had a stock split on July 3, 2000, with the old face value of Rs 10 split into a new face value of Rs 1. title: ITC shares gain marginally in today's session; over 60.1 lakh shares traded
content: ITC shares were trading at Rs 417.70 on the NSE at 2:20 pm, a gain of 0.20% from the previous close. Over 60.1 lakh shares changed hands in today's session. ITC's Financial Performance: ITC's financial performance reveals the following trends: Quarterly Performance: For the quarter ending March 2025, ITC reported a revenue of Rs 18,765 Crore and a net profit of Rs 19,709.47 Crore. The EPS stood at Rs 15.77 for the same period. A comparison of the quarters shows:Revenue: Increased from Rs 17,922.70 Crore in March 2024 to Rs 18,765 Crore in March 2025.Net Profit: Increased significantly from Rs 5,187.22 Crore in March 2024 to Rs 19,709.47 Crore in March 2025.EPS: Increased from Rs 4.10 in March 2024 to Rs 15.77 in March 2025.Annual Performance: For the year ending March 2025, ITC reported a revenue of Rs 75,323.34 Crore and a net profit of Rs 19,926.05 Crore. The EPS stood at Rs 27.79 for the same period. The company’s debt-to-equity ratio remained at 0.00. title: Glenmark shares among top gainers on Nifty Midcap 150; surge 14.41%
content: In Friday's trading session, Glenmark shares surged 14.41%, reaching Rs 2,178.30 and emerging as one of the top gainers on the Nifty Midcap 150 index. The stock demonstrated significant positive momentum in today's session.Glenmark Financial PerformanceGlenmark's financial performance reveals the following trends:Consolidated Quarterly ResultsHere is a summary of the consolidated quarterly results:HeadingMar 2024Jun 2024Sep 2024Dec 2024Mar 2025RevenueRs 3,062.95 CroreRs 3,244.19 CroreRs 3,433.80 CroreRs 3,387.55 CroreRs 3,256.21 CroreNet Profit-Rs 1,214.27 CroreRs 340.24 CroreRs 354.49 CroreRs 348.03 CroreRs 4.38 CroreEPS-43.1812.0612.5512.330.16The revenue for Glenmark saw fluctuations across the quarters, with a peak in September 2024 at Rs 3,433.80 Crore. Net profit showed significant recovery from a loss of Rs 1,214.27 Crore in March 2024 to a profit, though minimal, of Rs 4.38 Crore in March 2025.Consolidated Yearly ResultsThe consolidated yearly results are as follows:Heading20212022202320242025RevenueRs 10,943.93 CroreRs 12,304.90 CroreRs 12,990.11 CroreRs 11,813.10 CroreRs 13,321.74 CroreNet ProfitRs 970.09 CroreRs 993.65 CroreRs 377.40 Crore-Rs 1,830.85 CroreRs 1,047.14 CroreEPS34.3833.3710.53-53.2237.11BVPS250.36334.48348.70278.09313.60ROE13.7310.363.13-19.1311.83Debt to Equity0.660.400.460.130.25From 2021 to 2025, Glenmark's revenue increased from Rs 10,943.93 Crore to Rs 13,321.74 Crore. The net profit saw a significant dip in 2024 at -Rs 1,830.85 Crore but recovered to Rs 1,047.14 Crore in 2025. The debt-to-equity ratio decreased from 0.66 in 2021 to 0.25 in 2025.Consolidated Yearly Income StatementThe consolidated yearly income statement shows the following data (Values in Crore):Mar 2025Mar 2024Mar 2023Mar 2022Mar 2021Sales13,32111,81312,99012,30410,943Other Income11383931616650Total Income13,43512,65313,30612,47110,994Total Expenditure11,82912,10012,08810,7329,258EBIT1,6065521,2181,7391,735Interest207515349298353Tax3521,867491447412Net Profit1,047-1,830377993970Glenmark Corporate ActionsGlenmark has been actively involved in corporate actions. Recent announcements include analyst/investor meetings and press releases regarding Ichnos Glenmark Innovation's (IGI) global commercialization strategy and an exclusive global licensing agreement with AbbVie for ISB 2001. The company has a history of dividend payouts, with final dividends announced each year. For instance, a final dividend of Rs 2.50 per share (250%) was announced on May 24, 2024, with an effective date of September 13, 2024. Additionally, Glenmark had a bonus issue on January 6, 2005, with a bonus ratio of 1:1 and an ex-bonus date of March 4, 2005. The company also underwent stock splits, including one on June 11, 2007, where the face value changed from Rs 2 to Rs 1, and another on July 31, 2003, where the face value changed from Rs 10 to Rs 2. With a robust trading session and positive momentum, Glenmark is showing very bullish sentiment as per Moneycontrol analysis.

title: Top losers on Nifty Midcap 150 today: IREDA, Hitachi Energy, BSE Ltd, others drag
content: IREDA (Indian Renewable Energy Development Agency), Hitachi Energy, and BSE Limited were among the top losers on the Nifty Midcap 150 as of 2:30 PM on Friday. IREDA shares declined by 5.32% to Rs 160.62. Hitachi Energy shares dropped by 4.03% to Rs 18,690.00. BSE Limited shares fell by 3.41% to Rs 2,382.10. Apar Ind shares also saw a decline of 3.05%, trading at Rs 8,628.50, while UNO Minda shares decreased by 3.04% to Rs 1,065.20.IREDA FinancialsThe following table presents the consolidated quarterly financial data for Indian Renew:HeadingMar 2024Jun 2024Sep 2024Dec 2024Mar 2025RevenueRs 283.11 CroreRs 370.79 CroreRs 372.42 CroreRs 361.49 CroreRs 373.54 CroreNet Profit-Rs 53.66 Crore-Rs 13.99 Crore-Rs 13.21 Crore-Rs 30.06 Crore-Rs 29.45 CroreEPS-3.68-0.99-0.75-2.05-1.53The revenue for IREDA has shown a fluctuating trend over the last five quarters, with a high of Rs 373.54 Crore in March 2025 and a low of Rs 283.11 Crore in March 2024. The company has reported net losses in each of the last five quarters. title: Motilal Oswal bullish on Suzlon, sees up to 24% upside potential
content: Motilal Oswal Financial Services has reiterated its bullish stance on Suzlon Energy, projecting a 24 percent upside in the stock from current levels. In a recent note, the domestic brokerage firm maintained its ‘buy’ rating on Suzlon Energy with a price target of Rs 82 per share. Shares of Suzlon have gained over 24 percent in the past three months, according to data available on BSE Analytics. About a month ago, global and domestic investors including Goldman Sachs, Morgan Stanley, Motilal Oswal Mutual Fund, and Societe Generale acquired 19.81 crore equity shares—representing 1.45 percent stake—in Suzlon Energy for Rs 1,309 crore via open market transactions from promoter entities. For the March quarter, Suzlon reported a nearly five-fold jump in consolidated net profit to Rs 1,181 crore, up from Rs 254 crore a year earlier, supported by higher revenues. Its total income rose to Rs 3,825.19 crore from Rs 2,207.43 crore during the same period, as per a BSE filing. Disclaimer: The views and investment tips expressed by experts on Moneycontrol are their own and not those of the website or its management. Moneycontrol advises users to check with certified experts before taking any investment decisions.
summary_lexrank: Motilal Oswal Financial Services has reiterated its bullish stance on Suzlon Energy, projecting a 24 percent upside in the stock from current levels.
summary_luhn: In a recent note, the domestic brokerage firm maintained its ‘buy’ rating on Suzlon Energy with a price target of Rs 82 per share.
summary_lsa: Motilal Oswal Financial Services has reiterated its bullish stance on Suzlon Energy, projecting a 24 percent upside in the stock from current levels.
summary_textrank: For the March quarter, Suzlon reported a nearly five-fold jump in consolidated net profit to Rs 1,181 crore, up from Rs 254 crore a year earlier, supported by higher revenues.

Furthermore, Power Finance Corporation had a bonus issue with a ratio of 1:4, announced on August 11, 2023, with the ex-bonus date on September 21, 2023. Another bonus issue with a ratio of 1:1 was announced on July 14, 2016, with the ex-bonus date on August 26, 2016. With the stock's last traded price at Rs 434.70, Power Finance Corporation has demonstrated a positive movement, reflecting the recent surge in trading volume.

title: Hindustan Unilever shares surge 4.80%; among top gainers on Nifty 50
content: Hindustan Unilever shares are trading up 4.80% at Rs 2,524.00, marking it as one of the top gainers on the Nifty 50 in Friday's session. This hour, the stock saw positive movement, which is reflected in its current standing among the top performers. Financial Performance The following table summarizes the key consolidated quarterly financial data for Hindustan Unilever:HeadingMar 2024Jun 2024Sep 2024Dec 2024Mar 2025RevenueRs 15,210.00 CroreRs 15,707.00 CroreRs 15,926.00 CroreRs 15,818.00 CroreRs 15,670.00 CroreNet ProfitRs 2,561.00 CroreRs 2,614.00 CroreRs 2,601.00 CroreRs 2,988.00 CroreRs 2,476.00 CroreEPS10.8911.1111.0312.7010.48The revenue for Hindustan Unilever has seen a fluctuating trend over the last five quarters, with a high of Rs 15,926.00 Crore in September 2024 and currently stands at Rs 15,670.00 Crore for the quarter ending March 2025. Net profit also experienced fluctuations, reaching Rs 2,988.00 Crore in December 2024 but settling at Rs 2,476.00 Crore for March 2025. The EPS figures reflect these changes, with the highest EPS recorded in December 2024 at 12.70 and the latest EPS at 10.48. The company reported a debt-to-equity ratio of 0.00 as of the year-ending March 2025. Corporate Actions Hindustan Unilever's board has seen some changes recently. Mr. Rohit Jawa ceased to be the MD & CEO of the company effective close of business hours on July 31, 2025. Ms. Priya Nair has been appointed as the MD & CEO, effective August 1, 2025. These changes were a result of the board meeting held on July 10, 2025. The company has announced several dividends. A final dividend of Rs 24 per share was announced on April 24, 2025, with an effective date of June 23, 2025. An interim dividend of Rs 19 per share and a special dividend of Rs 10 per share were announced on October 10 and 11, 2024, respectively, both with an effective date of November 6, 2024. Hindustan Unilever has a history of bonus issues, with the last one being announced on September 30, 1991, in the ratio of 1:2. The company also underwent a stock split on July 5, 2000, where the face value changed from Rs 10 to Rs 1. Hindustan Unilever is currently among the top gainers on the Nifty 50.

title: Tata Consultancy Services share price falls 3.37%; among top losers on Nifty 50
content: Shares of Tata Consultancy Services declined by 3.37% to Rs 3,268.10, making it one of the top losers on the Nifty 50 during Friday's trading session. This decline reflects a very bearish sentiment, according to a recent Moneycontrol analysis, observed at 2:10 pm. Tata Consultancy Services is included as one of the stocks in the benchmark Nifty 50 index.Financial OverviewHere's a look at the consolidated financial performance of Tata Consultancy Services:Quarterly ResultsThe following table presents the quarterly financial data for Tata Consultancy Services:HeadingJun 2024Sep 2024Dec 2024Mar 2025Jun 2025RevenueRs 62,613.00 CroreRs 64,259.00 CroreRs 63,973.00 CroreRs 64,479.00 CroreRs 63,437.00 CroreNet ProfitRs 12,105.00 CroreRs 11,955.00 CroreRs 12,444.00 CroreRs 12,293.00 CroreRs 12,819.00 CroreEPS33.2832.9234.2133.7935.27The revenue for the quarter ending June 2025 stood at Rs 63,437.00 Crore, slightly lower compared to the Rs 64,479.00 Crore in the quarter ending March 2025. title: Godrej Properties share price falls 2% in Friday's session
content: Shares of Godrej Properties declined by 2% to Rs 2,211 in Friday's session, according to the latest market data. The stock's performance reflects a notable shift in investor sentiment, positioning it among the top losers on the Nifty Midcap 150 index. Godrej Properties is included as one of the stocks in the benchmark Nifty Midcap 150 index. Here is a summary of Godrej Properties' recent quarterly financial performance (Consolidated):HeadingMar 2024Jun 2024Sep 2024Dec 2024Mar 2025RevenueRs 1,426.09 CroreRs 739.00 CroreRs 1,093.23 CroreRs 968.88 CroreRs 2,121.73 CroreNet ProfitRs 440.96 CroreRs 580.60 CroreRs 336.95 CroreRs 176.48 CroreRs 413.80 CroreEPS16.9518.7012.065.7012.68The revenue for Godrej Properties in the quarter ending March 2025 was Rs 2,121.73 Crore, which is a significant increase compared to the revenue of Rs 1,426.09 Crore in the quarter ending March 2024. The net profit for the same period was Rs 413.80 Crore, compared to Rs 440.96 Crore in the previous year. The EPS stood at 12.68, down from 16.95 in March 2024. Key financial ratios for Godrej Properties show a P/E ratio of 43.44 and a P/B ratio of 3.70 as of March 2025. The company reported a debt-to-equity ratio of 0.73 as of the year-ending March 2025. title: Sensex down 700 pts, Nifty below 25,200 as weak TCS Q1 weighs; IT, auto, oil & gas stocks fall
content: Benchmark indices Nifty and Sensex deepened losses in afternoon trade on July 11, dragged down by sustained selling in IT, auto, and oil & gas stocks. Broader markets also slipped nearly a percent, mirroring the weak undertone. Gains in pharma and FMCG offered some cushion but weren’t enough to offset the overall decline. At about 12:20 pm, the Sensex was down 674.80 points or 0.81 percent at 82,515.48, and the Nifty was down 190.20 points or 0.75 percent at 25,165.05. About 1193 shares advanced, 2186 shares declined, and 129 shares remained unchanged. Follow our LIVE blog for all the latest market updates "A key trend in the first half of 2025 has been the clear outperformance of large caps over the broader market. India has also lagged global peers like South Korea, Germany, Japan, and the MSCI EM index, largely due to stretched valuations. TCS’s Q1 results highlight ongoing challenges for large-cap IT, though midcap IT may fare better. The quarter’s likely outperformers include telecom, oil and gas, and select auto segments. In this environment, investors would do well to focus on reasonably valued stocks with strong earnings visibility," says V K Vijayakumar, Chief Strategist at Geojit Investments Limited. Sectoral indices on the NSE were largely in the red during intraday trade on July 11, with broad-based weakness across key sectors. Nifty IT was the top laggard, down 1.85 percent, followed by Auto, and Oil & Gas, which were lower by over 1 percent each. Smallcap, and Midcap indices also saw cuts nearing 1 percent. Banking stocks remained under pressure, with Nifty Bank down 0.54 percent, PSU Bank falling 0.60 percent, and Private Bank slipping 0.29 percent. Losses were also seen in Consumer Durables, Energy, and Realty. In contrast, FMCG and Pharma provided some support, rising 0.85 percent and 0.50 percent, respectively. India VIX edged up 2.14 percent to 11.92, indicating a mild rise in market volatility. Also read: Who are in charge of Jane Street India? Among individual stocks, Glenmark Pharma stole the show with gains of 17 percent. This comes after the company announced that its subsidiary has signed an exclusive global licensing agreement for its investigational asset ISB 2001 with New York-based AbbVie. ISB 2001 is currently in the first phase of clinical trials for patients suffering from relapsed or refractory multiple myeloma, a type of cancer, the company said in an exchange filing. Shares of Hindustan Unilever jumped up to 5 percent on July 11 after the company announced Priya Nair as its new MD & CEO, succeeding Rohit Jawa, who steps down after a two-year stint. Nair, currently President of Beauty & Wellbeing, will be the first woman to lead HUL in its 92-year history. She oversees a €13.2 billion global portfolio, including brands like Dove, Sunsilk, Clear, and Vaseline. Read more: Glenmark’s R&D bet pays off handsomely with AbbVie deal, vindicating backer-in-chief Saldanha Tata Elxsi slipped 4 percent after the company reported a sharp drop in June quarter earnings, triggering concerns over demand headwinds and margin pressure. The disappointing performance also prompted global brokerages to cut estimates and maintain bearish views on the stock. "Nifty Index formed a Bearish Engulfing pattern on the daily chart, hinting at a short-term reversal. It is hovering near the 0.382 Fibonacci level and key support at 25,330–25,300. A breakdown below this zone may push it towards 25,100–25,000. On the upside, resistance is placed at 25,500, with a major hurdle near 25,600. The index remains under pressure unless it reclaims these levels," Mandar Bhojane of Choice Equity Broking said. For Bank Nifty, he said immediate support lies at 56,700–56,500, with a breakdown possibly taking it to 56,000. On the upside, resistance is at 57,000, with a key hurdle at 57,300–57,500. A breakout above this zone is crucial for bullish momentum to resume. HUL, SBI Life Insurance, Nestle, Sun Pharma, and Axis Bank were the top gainers on the Nifty. Laggards on the index included TCS, Wipro, Apollo Hospitals, M&M, and Bajaj Auto. title: Buy Glenmark Pharma; target of Rs 2430: Motilal Oswal
content: Motilal Oswal's research report on Glenmark Pharma AbbVie partnership signals a new era for Glenmark Pharma (GNP) GNP’s subsidiary, Ichnos Glenmark Innovation (IGI), has signed an exclusive licensing agreement with AbbVie for its lead investigational asset, ISB-2001. The deal validates several aspects of GNP: a) the strength of IGI’s BEAT protein platform for oncology and auto-immune diseases; b) the potential of ISB-2001 to treat relapsed/refractory multiple myeloma; and c) the commercial viability of ISB-2001 following successful clinical trials and subsequent commercialization. Outlook Accordingly, we assign a 27x 12M forward earnings to arrive at an SOTP of INR 2,430. Reiterate BUY. title: Sell Tata Elxsi ; target of Rs 4750: Prabhudas Lilladher
content: Prabhudas Lilladher's research report on Tata Elxsi The revenue de-growth was in line with our estimates, largely attributed to M&C and H&L, while Transportation business reported flat QoQ CC vs -9.7% QoQ CC in Q4. The transportation business growth is negatively impacted by Tier-1 suppliers, otherwise the deal ramp ups on the Auto OEMs have improved of late and compensating the weakness against Tier-1. The management sounded optimistic to drive growth within Transportation from Q2, while M&C would recover from Q3 led by large deal ramp up. The timely ramp ups of the automotive deals and continued engagement with OEMs on the new-age offerings, give confidence to the management to drive growth within Transportation. However, the structural demand for M&C and H&L remains weak due to business consolidation and tariff impact on medical devices, leading to pullback on R&D and discretionary spending. The reported margins were below our estimates by 100bps due to lower employee utilization and continued investments for future growth. We are adjusting our margins by 110 and 130bps due to Q1 miss for FY26E/FY27E. Outlook We expect CC revenue to decline by 3.5% in FY26E and growth of 9.1% YoY in FY27E, while expect EBIT margin of 19.9% and 21.8% in FY26E and FY27E respectively. We are assigning 33x PE to FY27E, translating a TP of 4,750. Maintain SELL. title: Tesla's India showroom gets set for launch, M&M drags Nifty Auto index as competition hots up
content: SUV maker M&M's shares are down nearly 2 percent in early trade on July 11, weighing on Nifty Auto index which is lower by 0.7 percent, as electric vehicle maker Tesla said it will be opening its first India showroom in Mumbai on July 15. The showroom will be called an 'experience center', said Tesla officials, bringing it closer to start selling its cars in India, which will be imported into the country. Shares of Bosch, a component supplier to Tesla, are higher by over 3 percent in the day's trade. Some of the other Indian suppliers to Tesla include names like Samvardhana Motherson International, Suprajit Engineering, Sona BLW Precision and Varroc Engineering. Amid a rising threat of additional tariffs by US President Trump, Moneycontrol on July 10 reported that Tesla has assured its Indian suppliers of continued procurement, irrespective of any levies. M&M Shares Sell Off Though under selling pressure in the share market on July 11, M&M emerged as the largest electric car and SUV player in Indian SUV segment in terms of revenue share during the March quarter, as per JATO data cited by the company. However, Tesla's entry is expected to intensify the competitive intensity in India's electric automotive space. In calendar year 2026, M&M has already announced plans to launch three ICE products, two born electric products, and two LCVs. On August 15, 2025, M&M has planned to reveal a new platform vision base, on which new products will start coming out from 2027. The SUV maker has opened up all markets - Tier I, II, even III, according to Rajesh Jejurikar, Automotive CEO at M&M, and is gradually increasing delivery of its EV offerings in all geographies. The booking momentum continues to be 'very steady and very strong', he said. "...this is a business which we don't want to be rash and ramping up for two reasons. One is, there is a lot of product complexity. We are learning new technologies as we ramp up and so are our suppliers. So, we have to be very cautious in the way we ramp up production," Rajesh Jejurikar had said in May 2025. HDFC Securities in a note on July 11 said it sees softer demand for Indian auto market, both domestically and globally, which will impact volume growth. TVS Motors could benefit from its successful models and variants, including the EVs, while Mahindra & Mahindra has been seeing increasing traction for UVs and tractors. Tesla's India Plans To begin with, Tesla has imported fully-built cars, and is likely to start selling its Model Y in India, sourced from its Shanghai factory, China, Bloomberg News reported on June 20. Some news reports had said that five Model Y cars have are already in Mumbai at a 70% import duty. The Model Y is the world’s largest selling electric car. Tesla has also imported Supercharger components, accessories, merchandise and spares from US, China and the Netherlands, the report said. For Tesla, India's high import duties on cars have been a major hurdle in its expansion plans, given the high tariff and then the tax levied on the sale of the car, making its vehicles more expensive to begin with. "..it would be a great market to enter because India has a big middle class, which we would want to tap in, and that is the market which we want to be in. But, again, these kind of things create a little bit of tension which we’re trying to work around," CFO Vaibhav Teneja had said during the Q12025 earnings call. Tesla has not yet named a replacement for its country head for India, after he resigned ahead of the planned entry into the world’s third-largest car market. The EV maker is reportedly also finalizing another showroom in Delhi's Aerocity, and has plans for an office in Bengaluru. Earlier this year, during PM Modi's US visit, Tesla founder and CEO Elon Musk met the Prime Minister to discuss strengthening collaboration between Indian and US entities. Tesla's India foray comes after years of discussions over Musk's concerns around tariffs and New Delhi's demand for local manufacturing. EVs make up over 5% of India's passenger vehicle sales and premium cars are still less than 2% of the total car market, as per official data.
summary_lexrank: So, we have to be very cautious in the way we ramp up production," Rajesh Jejurikar had said in May 2025.
summary_luhn: SUV maker M&M's shares are down nearly 2 percent in early trade on July 11, weighing on Nifty Auto index which is lower by 0.7 percent, as electric vehicle maker Tesla said it will be opening its first India showroom in Mumbai on July 15.
summary_lsa: HDFC Securities in a note on July 11 said it sees softer demand for Indian auto market, both domestically and globally, which will impact volume growth.
summary_textrank: M&M Shares Sell Off Though under selling pressure in the share market on July 11, M&M emerged as the largest electric car and SUV player in Indian SUV segment in terms of revenue share during the March quarter, as per JATO data cited by the company.

title: Buy Tata Consultancy Services; target of Rs 3920: Prabhudas Lilladher
content: Prabhudas Lilladher's research report on Tata Consultancy Services The revenue growth in Q1 was disappointing, missing our estimates materially by ~200bps QoQ, largely attributed to the ramp down in BSNL deal (down 2.8% QoQ CC). The degree of weakness further intensified due to slowdown in international business down 0.5% QoQ CC, attributed to a softness in BFSI (down 0.5% QoQ CC). Despite concluding Q1 on a weaker trajectory, the management was confident of achieving better revenue growth in FY26 vs FY25, for international business. The tariff induced verticals already remained soft, the weakness in Europe BFSI further stalling the international business outlook, evident through weak Q1 deal TCV in BFS. We expect FY26 international growth largely to be flat CC, which translates to an ask-rate of ~0.6% CQGR, while we expect the BSNL add-on will support the growth in Q2/Q3 before it sees further ramp-down in Q4. On the margins, utilization and rationalizing employee pyramid are the major levers, however the low-margin add-on BSNL deal would continue to weigh on FY26 margins. We are adjusting our revenue estimates for the quarterly miss while keeping our margins broadly unchanged. Outlook We expect CC revenue to decline by 1.4% in FY26E followed by a growth of 5.3% in FY27E, while we expect margins to be reported at 24.6% and 25.1% in FY26E and FY27E. We assign 25x to FY27EPS that translates a TP of 3,920. Maintain BUY. title: Mutual funds trump retail in Glenmark surge as cancer drug deal sends stock soaring
content: Mutual funds just beat retail shareholders hands down in Glenmark Pharmaceuticals, and the score wasn’t even close. After Glenmark’s landmark $2 billion licensing deal with US major AbbVie for its cancer drug, ISB 2001, the stock hit the 10% upper circuit on July 11. But the biggest winners weren’t retail investors — they were India’s top mutual funds that had steadily loaded up on the stock over the past two years. Data shows mutual fund ownership in Glenmark Pharma jumped from 9.1% in June 2023 to 14.6% in March 2025 — a clear signal of growing institutional conviction in the company’s innovation pipeline, even when public shareholders failed to fully price in its R&D potential. Promoters continue to hold a 46% stake, while FIIs remained steady at around 23%. Public shareholding, meanwhile, has declined from 20.4% to 15.56% during the same period, indicating that retail investors had been steadily exiting. The stock also had its share of marquee investors. Prashant Jain’s 3P India Equity Fund held just over 1% in Glenmark, while Ashish Dhawan held 1.77% in March 2025 in his personal capacity, although he pared his holding from 2.55% in September 2024. Among the fund houses that struck gold:-HDFC Mutual Fund was the most aggressive. Its Midcap Opportunities Fund held over 1.06 crore shares, while HDFC Manufacturing Fund and HDFC Balanced Advantage Fund also had sizable exposure, with 12 lakh and 8.85 lakh shares respectively.-UTI Value Fund (9 lakh shares), Bandhan Small-cap Fund (8.62 lakh), and Aditya Birla Sun Life Midcap Fund (7.01 lakh).-Mahindra Manulife Mutual Fund emerged as one of the top buyers in June. Its Multi Cap Fund added 8.45 lakh shares, and its Small Cap Fund disclosed another 3.6 lakh shares.-Invesco India Mid Cap Fund upped its stake by nearly 20%, picking up 2.74 lakh shares. FII activity in the stock remained mixed. Smallcap World Fund trimmed its stake from 4.84% in December 2023 to 3.21% in March 2025, while Norway’s Government Pension Fund Global maintained a 3.25% holding. Fund managers have clearly showed more faith in Glenmark’s R&D narrative than retail investors. The big institutional money rode on the belief that Glenmark’s innovation pipeline was undervalued — and this AbbVie licensing deal, with a $700 million upfront payout and $1.2 billion in milestones, proved them right.

title: Hindustan Zinc jumps 1.5%: Silver at lifetime high, other key reasons behind stock surge
content: The shares of Hindustan Zinc jumped over 1.5 percent on July 11 as prices of silver continued to rally. The Vedanta Group-owned company's shares were trading at Rs 430 apiece in the early trading hours. Silver's future contracts with September expiry opened at Rs 1.09 lakh per kg on the Multi Commodity Exchange (MCX). The prices then soared further to hit a lifetime high of over Rs Rs 1.11 lakh per kg. In the domestic markets, the price of one kilogram of silver gained Rs 1,000 in a single day to hover near Rs 1.11 lakh, according to data on Good Returns. Hindustan Zinc is the largest producer of silver in India, and produces refined silver with a minimum 99.9 percent purity. The sharp rise in the bullion's prices is expected to further boost the stock. Axis Securities remains bullish on silver prices, stating that the selloff in industrial metals was driving prices. Vedanta management denies 'Ponzi scheme' claims: The rise in the share price also comes after Vedanta Group denied 'Ponzi scheme' allegations levelled against it by American short-seller Viceroy Research. Vedanta Chairman Anil Agarwal told shareholders during its Annual General Meeting (AGM) on July 10 that the company has remained "extremely transparent". "[The report] appears to be a motivated report, but we will address it," he added. He further outlined the company's growth prospects in the near future. "Our 3D strategy, Demerger, Diversification and Deleveraging will enable us to double in size and unlock maximum value for our stakeholders… This is not just a story of growth, it is the story of realizing India’s aspirations. We are fully aligned with the needs of a developed Bharat," he said. Vedanta said that it has secured 10 critical mineral blocks across India, one of the largest by any private sector company. It is also setting up the world's first industrial Zinc Park and India's largest Aluminium Park, which is aimed at helping MSMEs and creating lakhs of employment opportunities. The positive outlook from the company's management may have also boosted the stock. Don't get distracted, says JPMorgan JPMorgan meanwhile said investors shouldn’t get distracted by the allegations, and it remains overweight on Vedanta. For Hindustan Zinc, the international brokerage said that the Indian government continues to maintain an active presence on its board, Mint reported. It added that government oversight continues to be effective, especially concerning capex planning. US-based short seller Viceroy Research on July 9 said that it has taken a short position on the debt of Vedanta Resources, saying that it resembles a 'Ponzi scheme'. It called the parent company of Vedanta a "parasite holding company with no significant operations of its own, propped up entirely by cash extracted from its dying host, Vedanta Limited". The American short-seller had alleged that Hindustan Zinc's resources are being "looted" through related-party deals with promoter-family owned companies and unjustifiable brand fees. "Vedanta's crown jewel may be its biggest liability," it said while speaking about Hindustan Zinc. Also read: Our LIVE blog on stock market updates Disclaimer: The views and investment tips expressed by experts on Moneycontrol are their own and not those of the website or its management. Moneycontrol advises users to check with certified experts before taking any investment decisions.

summary_luhn: US-based short seller Viceroy Research on July 9 said that it has taken a short position on the debt of Vedanta Resources, saying that it resembles a 'Ponzi scheme'.
summary_lsa: The American short-seller had alleged that Hindustan Zinc's resources are being "looted" through related-party deals with promoter-family owned companies and unjustifiable brand fees.
summary_textrank: In the domestic markets, the price of one kilogram of silver gained Rs 1,000 in a single day to hover near Rs 1.11 lakh, according to data on Good Returns.

title: Sell Tata Elxsi; target of Rs 4420: ICICI Securities
content: ICICI Securities research report on Tata Elxsi TATA Elxsi (TELX) reported a disappointing print vs I-Sec’s already muted estimates. Q1FY26 marks the fourth straight quarter of muted revenue performance. Large deal wins are taking longer to convert owing to the tough demand environment across verticals. With poor revenue performance, EBIT margin was also down to 18.2% (-823bps YoY), similar to its print during Covid. Transportation underperformed with flattish growth QoQ; not aligned with the optimistic commentary from Q4FY25. Management expects FY26 growth to be led by transportation business. Commentary on healthcare business has deteriorated from Q4FY25. Outlook We expect continued drag from media and healthcare verticals. Maintain SELL with a one-year forward TP of INR 4,420 on an unchanged target PE of 30x. Reduce FY26E EPS by 13% factoring in lower margins. For all recommendations report, click here Disclaimer: The views and investment tips expressed by investment experts/broking houses/rating agencies on moneycontrol.com are their own, and not that of the website or its management. Moneycontrol.com advises users to check with certified experts before taking any investment decisions. Tata Elxsi - 11072025 - icici

title: Bosch shares rise 2.06% in morning trade; stock among top gainers on Nifty Next 50
content: Shares of Bosch gained 2.06% to trade at Rs 36,940.00 in Friday's session. At 10:29 am, the stock is trading among the top gainers on the NIFTY NEXT 50. title: Oil India share price falls 2.01% in morning trade; stock among top midcap losers
content: Shares of Oil India declined by 2.01% to Rs 428.70 in Friday's session. The stock is currently trading on a bearish note, being one of the top losers on the Nifty Midcap 150 index. This marks a notable movement in price from the previous close. Financial Performance: The following table summarizes the consolidated quarterly financial performance of Oil India:HeadingMar 2024Jun 2024Sep 2024Dec 2024Mar 2025RevenueRs 9,147.01 CroreRs 8,120.21 CroreRs 7,247.03 CroreRs 8,336.90 CroreRs 8,808.34 CroreNet ProfitRs 1,973.77 CroreRs 1,892.49 CroreRs 1,843.22 CroreRs 1,593.17 CroreRs 1,769.40 CroreEPS19.7411.5912.408.238.05The revenue for Oil India in the quarter ending March 2025 was Rs 8,808.34 Crore, compared to Rs 9,147.01 Crore in the quarter ending March 2024. The net profit for the quarter ending March 2025 was Rs 1,769.40 Crore, a decrease compared to Rs 1,973.77 Crore in the quarter ending March 2024. The EPS stood at 8.05 for March 2025, down from 19.74 in March 2024. title: Mankind Pharma shares jump 4.93% amid volume surge; stock among top gainers on Nifty Midcap 150
content: Shares of Mankind Pharma gained 4.93% to trade at Rs 2,669.50 in Friday's session, showing significant positive momentum. The stock experienced a surge in volume and was among the top gainers on the Nifty Midcap 150 index at 10:21 am. Financial Snapshot: Here's a look at Mankind Pharma's recent financial performance (Consolidated):ParticularsMar 2024Jun 2024Sep 2024Dec 2024Mar 2025RevenueRs 2,441.10 CroreRs 2,893.42 CroreRs 3,076.51 CroreRs 3,230.00 CroreRs 3,079.37 CroreNet ProfitRs 474.18 CroreRs 539.16 CroreRs 656.31 CroreRs 381.08 CroreRs 422.33 CroreEPS11.7613.3916.319.4510.20The company's revenue has shown a fluctuating pattern over the last five quarters. The revenue increased from Rs 2,441.10 Crore in March 2024 to Rs 3,079.37 Crore in March 2025. title: Buy Tata Consultancy Services; target of Rs 4067: Deven Choksey
content: Deven Choksey's research report on Tata Consultancy Services TCS’s Q1FY26 revenue came in at NR 6,34,370 Mn. (-1.6% QoQ /+1.3% YoY), below our estimates by 2.4%, driven by ramp-down of BSNL deal and, weakness across North America, UK and Europe. Moreover, its revenue in CC terms was weaker at -3.1% YoY to USD 7,421 Mn. driven by higher cross currency impacts Outlook We have revised our FY26E/FY27E EPS estimate by -1.7%/-3.6% respectively, led by lower revenue conversion on the back of reduced demand. We value TCS at 25.0x Jun’27 EPS (~10-year avg NTM P/E), implying a target price of INR 4,067. For all recommendations report, click here Disclaimer: The views and investment tips expressed by investment experts/broking houses/rating agencies on moneycontrol.com are their own, and not that of the website or its management. Moneycontrol.com advises users to check with certified experts before taking any investment decisions. Tata Consultancy - 11072025 -deven

title: Bharti Airtel share price falls 1.25% in morning trade
content: Shares of Bharti Airtel declined by 1.25% to Rs 1,940 in Friday's morning session. This decline reflects the negative pressure on the stock as of 10:00 am. Financial Performance Bharti Airtel's consolidated financial performance shows consistent growth in revenue over the past five years. The company has also demonstrated a strong turnaround in net profit. Here’s an overview of the company’s key financial figures: Consolidated Revenue (Rs Crore)YearRevenue2021Rs 100,615.80 Crore2022Rs 116,546.90 Crore2023Rs 139,144.80 Crore2024Rs 149,982.40 Crore2025Rs 172,985.20 CroreThe revenue for the year 2025 increased by 15.34 percent compared to the year 2024. Consolidated Net Profit (Rs Crore)YearNet Profit2021-23,327.90 Crore2022Rs 5,882.00 Crore2023Rs 11,535.30 Crore2024Rs 5,848.60 Crore2025Rs 33,778.30 CroreThe net profit for the year 2025 increased significantly compared to the previous years. Consolidated EPS (Rs)YearEPS2021-27.6520227.67202314.80202413.09202558.00The EPS for the year 2025 is significantly higher compared to the previous years. Quarterly Financials The revenue for the quarter ending March 2025 was Rs 47,876.20 Crore, which is higher than the revenue for the quarter ending March 2024, which was Rs 37,599.10 Crore.QuarterRevenue (Rs Crore)Net Profit (Rs Crore)EPSMar 2024Rs 37,599.10 CroreRs 1,237.90 Crore3.61Jun 2024Rs 38,506.40 CroreRs 3,805.80 Crore7.21Sep 2024Rs 41,473.30 CroreRs 3,079.50 Crore6.21Dec 2024Rs 45,129.30 CroreRs 14,474.90 Crore25.54Mar 2025Rs 47,876.20 CroreRs 12,418.10 Crore19.02Corporate Actions Bharti Airtel announced a final dividend of Rs 16 per share on May 13, 2025, with the ex-date as July 18, 2025. Recent announcements by Bharti Airtel include the incorporation of a step-down wholly owned subsidiary, as disclosed under Regulation 30 of the SEBI (Listing Obligations and Disclosure Requirements) Regulations, 2015. Additionally, Bharti Airtel has chosen Ericsson core for Fixed Wireless Access, as per a press release dated July 09, 2025. Moneycontrol analysis on July 10, 2025, indicated a bullish sentiment for the stock. With the stock currently trading at Rs 1,940, Bharti Airtel reflects a slight downturn in today's session amid recent corporate developments and positive long-term financial performance.

title: Vodafone Idea shares fall 2.05% in morning trade; stock among top losers on Nifty Midcap 150
content: Shares of Vodafone Idea declined by 2.05% to Rs 7.18 in Friday's morning session, making it one of the top losers on the Nifty Midcap 150. At 10:14 am, the stock reflected a negative trend compared to its previous close. Financial Performance: Vodafone Idea's consolidated financial performance reveals the following trends: Quarterly Results:HeadingMar 2024Jun 2024Sep 2024Dec 2024Mar 2025RevenueRs 10,573.70 CroreRs 10,508.30 CroreRs 10,932.20 CroreRs 11,117.30 CroreRs 11,013.50 CroreNet Profit-Rs 7,672.00 Crore-Rs 6,432.20 Crore-Rs 7,175.60 Crore-Rs 6,609.30 Crore-Rs 7,168.10 CroreEPS-1.57-1.02-1.03-0.95-1.01The company's quarterly revenue has shown a fluctuating trend. The revenue for the quarter-ending March 2025 stood at Rs 11,013.50 Crore, slightly lower than the previous quarter's Rs 11,117.30 Crore. Net profit remained negative across all reported quarters, with a net loss of Rs 7,168.10 Crore for the quarter-ending March 2025. Similarly, the EPS has been negative, indicating losses on a per-share basis. Net profit remains negative, although the losses have decreased from Rs 31,232.90 Crore in 2024 to Rs 27,385.20 Crore in 2025. The EPS has also improved, moving from -6.41 in 2024 to -4.01 in 2025. The Debt to Equity ratio is negative. Vodafone Idea's revenue increased by 2.16% in 2025 compared to 2024. title: Accumulate Gravita India target of Rs 2385: Asit C Mehta
content: Asit C Mehta report on Gravita India Gravita India Ltd is a leading multinational recycling company headquartered in Jaipur, Rajasthan, India. Established in 1992, Gravita has emerged as one of the largest producers of lead and a prominent player in the recycling of aluminium, plastics, and rubber. It operates on a robust business model centered on sustainability and the circular economy, aiming to minimize waste and maximize resource efficiency. Company’s turnkey solutions for Lead Battery Recycling rand non-ferrous metals have set the industry standard, establishing as the world's leading provider. Company is recognized globally for their exceptional customer service and technical expertise. Its manufacturing facilities are located in Jaipur (Rajasthan), Kathua ( J&K), Mundra (Mundra), and Chittoor (AP) in India, as well as in Romania, Ghana, Mozambique, Togo, Senegal, Tanzania, and Sri Lanka. Outlook We project Gravita's revenue to grow at an ~25% CAGR from FY25-FY28E, fueled by increasing contributions from non-lead segments, its leading market position, consistent profit improvements, supportive regulations, and expanding product offerings. Accordingly, we recommend an "Accumulate" rating, setting a target price of ₹2,385 based on a 30.5x PE multiple applied to an estimated EPS of ₹78.20, implying a potential upside of around 28%. For all recommendations report, click here Disclaimer: The views and investment tips expressed by investment experts/broking houses/rating agencies on moneycontrol.com are their own, and not that of the website or its management. Moneycontrol.com advises users to check with certified experts before taking any investment decisions. Gravita India - 11072025 - asit
summary_lexrank: Established in 1992, Gravita has emerged as one of the largest producers of lead and a prominent player in the recycling of aluminium, plastics, and rubber.
summary_luhn: Asit C Mehta report on Gravita India Gravita India Ltd is a leading multinational recycling company headquartered in Jaipur, Rajasthan, India.
summary_lsa: Outlook We project Gravita's revenue to grow at an ~25% CAGR from FY25-FY28E, fueled by increasing contributions from non-lead segments, its leading market position, consistent profit improvements, supportive regulations, and expanding product offerings.

title: Premier Energies share price falls over 2% in morning trade
content: Shares of Premier Energies declined by 2.12% to Rs 1,092.20 in Friday's morning session. At 10:00 am, the stock reflected a negative trend. Premier Energies is included in the Nifty Midcap 150 index.Premier Energies: Financial PerformanceThe following table summarizes the key financial data for Premier Energies:Financials (Consolidated)Mar 2023Mar 2024Mar 2025RevenueRs 1,428.53 CroreRs 3,143.79 CroreRs 6,518.75 CroreNet ProfitRs -14.56 CroreRs 230.04 CroreRs 936.42 CroreEPSRs -0.38Rs 6.93Rs 21.35BVPSRs 9.16Rs 18.10Rs 62.61ROE-5.3048.5033.20Debt to Equity3.162.920.67The company's revenue increased significantly from Rs 1,428.53 Crore in March 2023 to Rs 6,518.75 Crore in March 2025. Net profit also saw a substantial increase, from a loss of Rs 14.56 Crore in March 2023 to a profit of Rs 936.42 Crore in March 2025. Earnings per share (EPS) also improved from Rs -0.38 to Rs 21.35 during the same period.Premier Energies: Quarterly FinancialsThe revenue for the quarter ending March 2025 stood at Rs 1,620.84 Crore, while the net profit for the same period was Rs 277.93 Crore. The EPS for March 2025 was Rs 6.16.Quarterly Data (Consolidated)Mar 2024Jun 2024Sep 2024Dec 2024Mar 2025RevenueRs 1,126.59 CroreRs 1,657.37 CroreRs 1,527.22 CroreRs 1,713.32 CroreRs 1,620.84 CroreNet ProfitRs 103.62 CroreRs 197.50 CroreRs 205.90 CroreRs 255.08 CroreRs 277.93 CroreEPSRs 3.93Rs 5.50Rs 5.71Rs 5.66Rs 6.16Premier Energies: Key Financial RatiosKey financial ratios for Premier Energies show a debt-to-equity ratio of 0.67 as of the year-ending March 2025. Other valuation ratios for Premier Energies include P/E (x) of 43.93, P/B (x) of 14.98 and EV/EBITDA (x) of 22.02 as of March 2025.Premier Energies: Corporate ActionsPremier Energies Limited announced a trading window closure as per SEBI regulations. The company also declared a final dividend of Rs 0.50 per share (50%) with the announcement on May 19, 2025. Prior to that, an interim dividend of Rs 0.50 per share (50%) was announced on February 3, 2025, and was effective from February 14, 2025. The stock's last traded price was Rs 1,092.20, reflecting a decrease in the current trading session.

title: BSE Limited shares fall 2.10%, among top midcap losers in morning trade today
content: Shares of BSE Limited declined by 2.10% to Rs 2,414.40 in Friday's session. This decline positions the stock among the top losers on the Nifty Midcap 150 index, reflecting bearish investor sentiment. The stock's movement comes amidst a recent Moneycontrol analysis indicating a bearish outlook as of July 4, 2025. Financial Snapshot: Here's a look at BSE Limited's recent financial performance:ParticularsMar 2025Mar 2024Mar 2023Mar 2022Mar 2021Revenue (Rs Crore)3,212.041,592.50924.84743.15501.37Net Profit (Rs Crore)1,239.73699.84156.42180.7598.55EPS96.5556.6616.0618.5130.94BVPS326.84255.24208.86206.26559.09ROE (%)29.9723.578.169.585.81Debt to Equity0.000.000.000.000.00The company's revenue has shown substantial growth over the years. Net profit also saw a considerable rise, reaching Rs 1,239.73 Crore in 2025 from Rs 699.84 Crore in the previous year. Similarly, the Earnings Per Share (EPS) increased to Rs 96.55 in 2025 from Rs 56.66 in 2024. Quarterly Performance: The consolidated quarterly results indicate a consistent upward trend in revenue. For the quarter ending March 2025, the company reported a revenue of Rs 916.97 Crore, up from Rs 544.77 Crore in March 2024. The net profit for the same period stood at Rs 478.04 Crore, compared to Rs 82.49 Crore in the previous year. title: Mazagon Dock Shipbuilders shares fall 2.15%, among top midcap losers in early trade today
content: Shares of Mazagon Dock Shipbuilders declined 2.15% to Rs 3,192.70 in Friday's early trading session. This decline positions the stock among the top losers on the Nifty Midcap 150. On the financial front, Mazagon Dock Shipbuilders has shown significant growth in recent years. Consolidated annual revenue increased from Rs 4,047.82 Crore in 2021 to Rs 11,431.88 Crore in 2025. Net profit also saw a substantial rise, from Rs 453.47 Crore in 2021 to Rs 2,277.34 Crore in 2025. Earnings per share (EPS) increased from Rs 25.48 in 2021 to Rs 59.83 in 2025. The company's debt-to-equity ratio has remained at 0.00 from 2021 to 2025.Financial YearRevenue (Rs Crore)Net Profit (Rs Crore)EPS (Rs)Debt to Equity20214,047.82453.4725.480.0020225,733.28563.1130.290.0020237,827.181,046.0755.480.0020249,466.581,808.8896.040.00202511,431.882,277.3459.830.00The company's standalone annual income statement for the year ending March 2025 shows sales of Rs 11,431 Crore, other income of Rs 1,168 Crore, and total income of Rs 12,600 Crore. Total expenditure amounted to Rs 9,487 Crore, resulting in an EBIT of Rs 3,113 Crore. Interest expenses were Rs 4 Crore, and tax expenses were Rs 784 Crore, leading to a net profit of Rs 2,324 Crore.ParticularsMar 2025 (Rs Crore)Mar 2024 (Rs Crore)Mar 2023 (Rs Crore)Mar 2022 (Rs Crore)Mar 2021 (Rs Crore)Sales11,4319,4667,8275,7334,047Other Income1,1681,138713433600Total Income12,60010,6048,5406,1664,648Total Expenditure9,4878,1387,1045,3874,009EBIT3,1132,4661,435779638Interest45678Tax784615356186150Net Profit2,3241,8451,072586479The standalone quarterly income statement reveals sales of Rs 3,174 Crore for the quarter ending March 2025, compared to Rs 3,103 Crore for the quarter ending March 2024. The net profit for the quarter ending March 2025 stood at Rs 326 Crore, while it was Rs 654 Crore for the quarter ending March 2024.ParticularsMar 2025 (Rs Crore)Dec 2024 (Rs Crore)Sep 2024 (Rs Crore)Jun 2024 (Rs Crore)Mar 2024 (Rs Crore)Sales3,1743,1432,7562,3573,103Other Income346286265271376Total Income3,5203,4303,0222,6283,479Total Expenditure3,1132,3662,2691,7382,602EBIT4071,063752889877Interest11111Tax79294187222221Net Profit326768563665654Key ratios for Mazagon Dock Shipbuilders as of March 2025 include a P/E ratio of 45.88 and a P/B ratio of 14.85. The company’s debt-to-equity ratio stands at 0.00 as of March 2025. Mazagon Dock Shipbuilders announced several corporate actions, including an acquisition of a controlling stake in Colombo Dockyard PLC approved on June 27, 2025. Additionally, the trading window for dealing in securities of MDL by designated persons and their immediate relatives remains closed from July 1, 2025, until 48 hours after the declaration of financial results for the quarter ending June 30, 2025. The company also held an investor earnings call on May 30, 2025, for Q4FY25. The company announced an interim dividend of Rs 3.00 per share (60%) on April 8, 2025, with an effective date of April 16, 2025. A stock split was announced on October 22, 2024, with the old face value of Rs 10 being split into a new face value of Rs 5. The ex-split date and record date were both December 27, 2024. As of Friday morning, Mazagon Dock Shipbuilders is trading lower, influenced by overall market dynamics and recent corporate announcements. The stock is currently trading at Rs 3,192.70, reflecting the early market sentiment.

title: Larsen & Toubro shares trade flat in early session

The company's revenue for the quarter-ending March 2025 stood at Rs 74,392.28 Crore, compared to Rs 67,078.68 Crore in March 2024. title: Wipro share price falls 2.38% in early trade
content: Shares of Wipro declined by 2.38% to Rs 258.75 in early trading on Friday. The stock is currently trading on the Nifty 50 index. This decline comes amidst a neutral sentiment analysis as of July 10, 2025, according to a Moneycontrol analysis. Financial Performance: The following table presents Wipro's consolidated quarterly financial performance:HeadingMar 2024Jun 2024Sep 2024Dec 2024Mar 2025RevenueRs 22,208.30 CroreRs 21,963.80 CroreRs 22,301.60 CroreRs 22,318.80 CroreRs 22,504.20 CroreNet ProfitRs 2,878.40 CroreRs 3,041.10 CroreRs 3,226.30 CroreRs 3,366.20 CroreRs 3,559.00 CroreEPS5.435.756.143.213.41The revenue for the quarter ending March 2025 stood at Rs 22,504.20 Crore, an increase compared to Rs 22,208.30 Crore in March 2024. The net profit for the same period increased to Rs 3,559.00 Crore from Rs 2,878.40 Crore in the previous year. The following table presents Wipro's consolidated yearly financial performance:Heading20212022202320242025RevenueRs 61,934.90 CroreRs 79,312.00 CroreRs 90,487.60 CroreRs 89,760.30 CroreRs 89,088.40 CroreNet ProfitRs 10,855.00 CroreRs 12,237.70 CroreRs 11,372.20 CroreRs 11,135.40 CroreRs 13,192.60 CroreEPS19.1122.3720.7320.8912.56BVPS100.48119.40141.63142.6578.65ROE19.6618.6914.6114.8115.94Debt to Equity0.120.230.190.190.20The annual revenue for the year ending March 2025 was Rs 89,088.40 Crore, a slight decrease from Rs 89,760.30 Crore in March 2024. However, the net profit increased to Rs 13,192.60 Crore in March 2025 from Rs 11,135.40 Crore in the previous year. The company reported a debt-to-equity ratio of 0.20 as of the year-ending March 2025. Corporate Actions: Wipro is set to announce results for the first quarter ended June 30, 2025, on July 17, 2025. Additionally, the trading window for dealing in the company's securities is closed from June 16, 2025, until the close of July 19, 2025. Wipro had announced an interim dividend of Rs 6 per share (300%) on January 17, 2025, with an effective date of January 28, 2025. The company had also announced a bonus issue on October 17, 2024, with an existing ratio of 1:1, and an ex-bonus date of December 3, 2024. Wipro last split its shares on April 30, 1999, from a face value of Rs 10 to Rs 2, with an ex-split date of September 27, 1999. The stock's current decline reflects early market volatility amid upcoming financial announcements.

title: Cochin Shipyard shares fall 2.20% in early trade today

Cochin Shipyard is included as one of the stocks in the Nifty Midcap 150 index. title: HUL shares jump 4.15%, stock among top gainers on Nifty 50 in today's trading session
content: Shares of HUL showed strong performance in early trade on Friday, gaining 4.15% to trade at Rs 2,508.40. This places the stock among the top gainers on the Nifty 50 index, reflecting positive investor sentiment during the session. Other top gainers on the Nifty 50 included IndusInd Bank, TATA Cons. Prod, SBI Life Insura, and Axis Bank, which saw gains of 0.96%, 0.8%, 0.73%, and 0.63% respectively. These early market movements indicate a potentially positive start for these stocks in today's trading session. Here's a look at the recent financial performance of HUL:HeadingMar 2024Jun 2024Sep 2024Dec 2024Mar 2025RevenueRs 15,210.00 CroreRs 15,707.00 CroreRs 15,926.00 CroreRs 15,818.00 CroreRs 15,670.00 CroreNet ProfitRs 2,561.00 CroreRs 2,614.00 CroreRs 2,601.00 CroreRs 2,988.00 CroreRs 2,476.00 CroreEPS10.8911.1111.0312.7010.48The consolidated quarterly revenue for HUL has shown a fluctuating trend over the past year. The revenue was Rs 15,210.00 Crore for the quarter ending March 2024, which increased to Rs 15,707.00 Crore by June 2024 and further to Rs 15,926.00 Crore by September 2024. However, it slightly decreased to Rs 15,818.00 Crore in December 2024 and settled at Rs 15,670.00 Crore for the quarter ending March 2025. The net profit also experienced some fluctuation, starting at Rs 2,561.00 Crore in March 2024, increasing to Rs 2,614.00 Crore in June 2024, and then slightly decreasing to Rs 2,601.00 Crore in September 2024. The net profit saw a peak in December 2024 at Rs 2,988.00 Crore but decreased to Rs 2,476.00 Crore in March 2025. Here's a look at the key financial figures over the past five years:Heading20212022202320242025RevenueRs 47,028.00 CroreRs 52,446.00 CroreRs 60,580.00 CroreRs 61,896.00 CroreRs 63,121.00 CroreNet ProfitRs 8,000.00 CroreRs 8,887.00 CroreRs 10,145.00 CroreRs 10,286.00 CroreRs 10,679.00 CroreEPS34.0337.7943.0743.7445.32BVPS202.95208.88214.99217.95210.22ROE16.7718.0920.1120.0621.55Debt to Equity0.000.000.000.000.00The annual revenue for HUL has shown a consistent increase over the past five years, from Rs 47,028.00 Crore in 2021 to Rs 63,121.00 Crore in 2025. The net profit has also increased, from Rs 8,000.00 Crore in 2021 to Rs 10,679.00 Crore in 2025. Earnings per share (EPS) have risen from 34.03 in 2021 to 45.32 in 2025. Here is a summary of the company's income statement:Mar 2025Mar 2024Mar 2023Mar 2022Mar 2021Sales63,12161,89660,58052,44647,028Other Income1,017811512258410Total Income64,13862,70761,09252,70447,438Total Expenditure49,32048,44347,63240,72436,715EBIT14,81814,26413,46011,98010,723Interest395334114106117Tax3,7443,6443,2012,9872,606Net Profit10,67910,28610,1458,8878,000HUL's sales have consistently increased from March 2021 to March 2025, showcasing steady growth. Sales increased from Rs 47,028 Crore in March 2021 to Rs 63,121 Crore in March 2025. Net profit has also shown growth over the years, increasing from Rs 8,000 Crore in March 2021 to Rs 10,679 Crore in March 2025. The company has announced several changes in management. Mr. Rohit Jawa will cease to be the MD & CEO of the Company effective close of business hours on 31st July 2025. Ms. Priya Nair has been appointed as MD & CEO effective 1st August 2025. These changes were outcomes of the Board Meeting held on 10th July 2025. HUL had also announced a final dividend of Rs 24.00 per share (2400%) on April 24, 2025, which was effective from June 23, 2025. With the stock's last traded price reflecting positive momentum, HUL demonstrates a strong presence among Nifty 50 gainers in today's early trading session.

title: Glenmark Pharma shares rally 15% to record high after mega licensing deal for its cancer drug
content: The shares of Glenmark Pharma jumped 15 percent to hit a fresh 52-week high record on July 11. This comes after the company announced that its subsidiary has signed an exclusive global licensing agreement for its investigational asset ISB 2001 with New York-based AbbVie. In an exchange filing released in the post market hours of July 10, Glenmark announced that its step-down wholly-owned subsidiary, Ichnos Glenmark Innovation (IGI), has signed the agreement with AbbVie. ISB 2001 is currently in the first phase of clinical trials for patients suffering from relapsed or refractory multiple myeloma, a type of cancer, the company said in an exchange filing. As part of the deal, AbbVie will get the exclusive right to develop, manufacture, and commercialise ISB 2001 across North America, Europe, Japan, and China. Glenmark will meanwhile develop, manufacture and lead commercialization of ISB 2001 across Emerging Markets including the rest of Asia, Latin America, the Russia/CIS region, the Middle East, Africa, Australia, New Zealand and South Korea. Glenmark's subsidiary will get an upfront payment of $700 million, and will be eligible to receive up to $1.225 billion in development, regulatory, and commercial milestone payments, along with tiered, double-digit royalties on net sales, as part of the deal. The pact was signed by IGI Therapeutics SA, a wholly owned subsidiary of Ichnos Glenmark Innovation, Inc., which is a subsidiary of Glenmark Pharmaceuticals. The US Food and Drug Administration had granted ISB 2001 orphan drug designation in July 2003 and fast-track designation in May for the treatment of relapsed or refractory myeloma patients. “Multispecifics including trispecific antibodies represent a new frontier in immuno-oncology with the potential to deliver deeper, more durable responses by engaging multiple targets simultaneously,” said Roopal Thakkar, M.D., Executive Vice-President, Research and Development and Chief Scientific Officer, AbbVie. “This partnership with IGI reflects our unwavering commitment to advancing novel therapies for patients with multiple myeloma, a disease where significant unmet need remains despite recent progress,” Thakkar added. “ISB 2001 exemplifies the potential of our BEAT® protein platform to generate effective multispecificsTM that may overcome resistance and improve outcomes in hard-to-treat cancers,” said Cyril Konto, M.D., President and CEO of IGI. "This agreement marks a defining milestone in IGI’s scientific journey and reflects our team’s deep commitment to delivering meaningful therapies for patients. Our partnership with AbbVie accelerates ISB 2001’s path to patients and sharpens our focus on advancing the next generation of BEAT®-enabled assets in oncology.” Glenmark Pharma shares have so far gained over 14 percent in the past five days, and more than 28 percent in the past one month. The stock gained nearly 40 percent in the past six months, and over 51 percent in the past one year. Nomura has kept a ''neutral' call on the stock, with a target price of Rs 1,500 per share. This implies a downside potential of more than 21 percent from the stock’s previous closing price of Rs 1,904 apiece. The brokerage said that the licensing deal is the largest by any Indian pharma company. The deal value has also beat its expectations. Also read: Our LIVE blog on stock market updates The shares of the company broke the 10 percent upper circuit in the morning of July 11, and are currently locked at the 15 percent limit at Rs 2,189.60 apiece. Disclaimer: The views and investment tips expressed by experts on Moneycontrol are their own and not those of the website or its management. Moneycontrol advises users to check with certified experts before taking any investment decisions.

title: Ajanta Pharma shares rise 2.10% in today's trading session
content: Ajanta Pharma shares gained 2.10%, trading at Rs 2,645.60 on Friday morning. The stock's performance places it among the gainers on the Nifty Midcap 150 index. The rise was recorded at 09:28 am. Financial Performance: Ajanta Pharma's financial performance shows consistent growth in both quarterly and yearly results. Here’s an overview: Quarterly Results (Consolidated):HeadingMar 2024Jun 2024Sep 2024Dec 2024Mar 2025RevenueRs 1,054.08 CroreRs 1,144.92 CroreRs 1,186.64 CroreRs 1,146.13 CroreRs 1,170.41 CroreNet ProfitRs 202.72 CroreRs 245.77 CroreRs 216.48 CroreRs 232.88 CroreRs 225.26 CroreEPS16.1019.5417.2718.6018.00The quarterly revenue has increased from Rs 1,054.08 Crore in March 2024 to Rs 1,170.41 Crore in March 2025. The net profit also saw an increase, moving from Rs 202.72 Crore to Rs 225.26 Crore for the same period. Annual Results (Consolidated):Heading20212022202320242025RevenueRs 2,889.69 CroreRs 3,340.99 CroreRs 3,742.64 CroreRs 4,208.71 CroreRs 4,648.10 CroreNet ProfitRs 653.87 CroreRs 712.68 CroreRs 587.98 CroreRs 816.17 CroreRs 920.39 CroreEPS75.0982.4545.8964.8273.56BVPS344.52380.24268.14282.34302.38ROE21.8221.8317.3522.8724.28Debt to Equity0.000.000.000.000.00The annual revenue increased from Rs 2,889.69 Crore in 2021 to Rs 4,648.10 Crore in 2025. Net profit also rose from Rs 653.87 Crore to Rs 920.39 Crore over the same period. The compounded annual growth rate (CAGR) for sales over the past 3 years is 17.95%. Key Financial Ratios:RatioMar 2021Mar 2022Mar 2023Mar 2024Mar 2025Basic EPS (Rs.)75.0982.4545.8964.8273.56P/E (x)15.9114.6426.3434.4235.66P/B (x)5.214.764.517.938.66The company's P/E ratio stands at 35.66, and the P/B ratio is 8.66 as of March 2025. The debt-to-equity ratio remains at 0.00. Corporate Actions: Ajanta Pharma has a history of corporate actions, including dividends and bonus issues. The company announced an interim dividend of Rs 28 per share (1400%) on October 25, 2024, with an effective date of November 6, 2024. A bonus issue was announced on May 10, 2022, with a ratio of 1:2 and an ex-bonus date of June 22, 2022. With the stock's last traded price at Rs 2,645.60, Ajanta Pharma is currently trading positively, reflecting a gain of 2.10% in today's session.

title: Infosys stock falls 2.64%, among top losers on Nifty 50; check other stocks dragging the index
content: Shares of Infosys declined 2.64% to Rs 1,573.20 in early trade on Friday. The stock is among the top losers on the Nifty 50 index. Other top losers on the Nifty 50 included TCS, Tech Mahindra, Trent and Apollo Hospital. Financial Performance The consolidated financial performance of Infosys reveals the following trends: Quarterly Results: The revenue for the quarter-ending March 2025 stood at Rs 40,925 Crore, compared to Rs 37,923 Crore for the quarter-ending March 2024. Net profit for the quarter-ending March 2025 was Rs 7,038 Crore, while in the quarter-ending March 2024, the net profit was Rs 7,975 Crore. title: Tata Elxsi stock falls 7% after weak Q1; brokerages turn bearish on growth outlook
content: Shares of Tata Elxsi slipped as much as 7 percent to Rs 5,660 in morning trade on Friday, July 11, after the company reported a sharp drop in June quarter earnings, triggering concerns over demand headwinds and margin pressure. The disappointing performance also prompted global brokerages to cut estimates and maintain bearish views on the stock. Morgan Stanley retained its Underweight rating with a target price of Rs 4,660, implying a downside potential of 24 percent from the last close on the NSE. The brokerage said the company missed expectations despite low investor forecasts. While management remained hopeful of a recovery led by auto and media verticals, analysts flagged that the stock has outperformed peers despite an ongoing earnings downgrade cycle. Follow our LIVE blog for all the latest market updates JPMorgan also reiterated an Underweight call, lowering its target to Rs 3,800. It highlighted that this was the fourth consecutive quarter of revenue and margin miss. The brokerage expects auto deal ramp-ups to be gradual and flagged lingering tariff-related uncertainty in the US market. It expects telecom to return to growth from Q2 but trimmed FY26–28 earnings estimates by 3–5 percent. Tata Elxsi posted a 22 percent year-on-year decline in net profit at Rs 144 crore for Q1FY26, compared to Rs 184 crore a year ago. Revenue fell 3.7 percent to Rs 892 crore, dragged by weakness in the automotive and transportation segment, which makes up over half its top line. EBITDA dropped 26 percent year-on-year to Rs 187 crore. CEO Manoj Raghavan said the quarter was marked by macro and client-specific challenges, impacting R&D spend and slowing decision cycles. Despite this, he said the company remains focused on large deal execution and building long-term customer relationships. At about 9:30 am, shares of the company were trading at Rs 5,880, lower by 4.4 percent from the last close on the NSE. Tata Elxsi shares are down nearly 10 percent since the beginning of the year. Disclaimer: The views and investment tips expressed by experts on Moneycontrol are their own and not those of the website or its management. Moneycontrol advises users to check with certified experts before taking any investment decisions.
summary_lexrank: Tata Elxsi posted a 22 percent year-on-year decline in net profit at Rs 144 crore for Q1FY26, compared to Rs 184 crore a year ago.
summary_luhn: Morgan Stanley retained its Underweight rating with a target price of Rs 4,660, implying a downside potential of 24 percent from the last close on the NSE.
summary_lsa: While management remained hopeful of a recovery led by auto and media verticals, analysts flagged that the stock has outperformed peers despite an ongoing earnings downgrade cycle.
summary_textrank: At about 9:30 am, shares of the company were trading at Rs 5,880, lower by 4.4 percent from the last close on the NSE.

title: IREDA shares tank 6% as Q1 profit slumps 36% as bad loans surge; Gensol exposure in focus
content: Shares of Indian Renewable Energy Development Agency (IREDA) slipped 6 percent to Rs 160 in morning trade on July 11 after its asset quality took a sharp hit in the June quarter, overshadowing strong loan growth and denting investor sentiment. The state-run lender reported a 35.7 percent year-on-year drop in net profit to Rs 247 crore, largely due to a rise in bad loans. Gross non-performing assets (NPAs) jumped to 4.13 percent from 2.45 percent in the March quarter, while net NPAs worsened to 2.05 percent from 1.35 percent. The deterioration comes amid mounting concerns over IREDA’s exposure to Gensol Engineering, which is currently undergoing insolvency proceedings. Follow our LIVE blog for all the latest market updates IREDA has a total exposure of Rs 470 crore to Gensol, comprising a Rs 254.9 crore term loan and working capital lines worth Rs 215.7 crore. Earlier this month, the National Company Law Tribunal admitted IREDA’s insolvency petition against the troubled borrower, turning the spotlight on its asset quality metrics—long considered a key monitorable. Despite the pressure on the bottom line, operational momentum remained strong. Total income rose nearly 29 percent year-on-year to Rs 1,947 crore, backed by a surge in loan activity. Loan sanctions climbed 28.5 percent to Rs 11,740 crore, while disbursements during the April-June period stood at Rs 6,981 crore, up 31.1 percent from a year earlier. The lender’s loan book expanded to nearly Rs 80,000 crore—up 26.5 percent from Rs 63,207 crore last year. The stock remains more than 40 percent below its all-time high of Rs 310. IREDA shares are down over 20 percent since the beginning of the year. Disclaimer: The views and investment tips expressed by experts on Moneycontrol are their own and not those of the website or its management. Moneycontrol advises users to check with certified experts before taking any investment decisions.

summary_luhn: Gross non-performing assets (NPAs) jumped to 4.13 percent from 2.45 percent in the March quarter, while net NPAs worsened to 2.05 percent from 1.35 percent.
summary_lsa: The deterioration comes amid mounting concerns over IREDA’s exposure to Gensol Engineering, which is currently undergoing insolvency proceedings.
